contentList.content: It has lots of cool stuff FUCK
Strong castle-forged steel surmounts a grip of sturdy leather - this immense sword is gleaming with radiant light.
Possibly inflict <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> when hitting a creature with this weapon.
Possibly inflict <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING_HOLY">Holy Fire</LSTag> when dealing radiant damage with melee attacks.
While your target is burning with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING_HOLY">Holy Fire</LSTag>, this weapon deals an additional [1].
When you use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ChannelOath">Channel Oath</LSTag> spells, you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLESS">Bless</LSTag>.
Suede covers the palms of these gloves - ensuring a soft, comforting touch for anyone in need of help.
The soft hum of a fervent prayer reverberates throughout the armoured plates.
A set of runes has been expertly worked into the helmet's filigree. Almost imperceptible - but powerful nonetheless.
The soft hum of a fervent prayer reverberates throughout the armoured plates.
Nightsong's armour is evocative of her personality - prickly, hardy, and about as agreeable as a clenched fist.

To break one's oath is a dangerous game - it marks you as a faithless cur, an exile without a cause. This armour is tempered by an age of rocks, blades, and persecution turned against it - and is buffed by the immutable, unbindable will of its wearer.
Worn by a scoundrel of the lowest morals and the highest cunning.

'When I found Carixim, he turned to me, all those poor people's souls crammed into him like too many bees in a rotten hive, and he... He grinned at me. And he said: I been expecting you, boy.' - Overheard from the smith Dammon

'Beneath those horrible sounds of... well, let's call it what it was: torment, Beneath the tormented screams I heard this moaning sound like many people in pain, and I heard the ringing of a great hammer. Carixim's forge was close.' - Overheard from the smith Dammon

Clad on the desiccated feet of a death knight, these boots have walked a long and terrible path. They strode through the tattered remains of their owner's oath. With every heavy footstep, they have sounded pure fear into the hearts of men.
Nightsong's armour is evocative of her personality - prickly, hardy, and about as agreeable as a clenched fist.
This longsword never dulls, although an observer may notice it quietly drinks the blood of slain enemies.

The Dame's resentment and anger toward Ketheric cannot be overstated. Still, her dreams rove sweeter corners, beyond the cruel hardwood floors of vengeance, the rooms of pain and discipline. Hers is a complex house, a house of the heart.
Nightsong's armour is evocative of her personality - prickly, hardy, and about as agreeable as a clenched fist.
Nightsong's armour is evocative of her personality - prickly, hardy, and about as agreeable as a clenched fist.
Nightsong's armour is evocative of her personality - prickly, hardy, and about as agreeable as a clenched fist.
This longsword never dulls, although an observer may notice it quietly drinks the blood of slain enemies.
This longsword never dulls, although an observer may notice it quietly drinks the blood of slain enemies.

The Dame's resentment and anger toward Ketheric cannot be overstated. Still, her dreams rove sweeter corners, beyond the cruel hardwood floors of vengeance, the rooms of pain and discipline. Hers is a complex house, a house of the heart.

The Dame's resentment and anger toward Ketheric cannot be overstated. Still, her dreams rove sweeter corners, beyond the cruel hardwood floors of vengeance, the rooms of pain and discipline. Hers is a complex house, a house of the heart.

The Dame's resentment and anger toward Ketheric cannot be overstated. Still, her dreams rove sweeter corners, beyond the cruel hardwood floors of vengeance, the rooms of pain and discipline. Hers is a complex house, a house of the heart.

When you kill a creature with one of your Smite spells, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> plus your paladin level.
Gained [1] <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit point(s)</LSTag> from <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="RHERB_SmiteKill_TempHP_Passive">Bolstering Smite</LSTag>.
Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, when you kill a creature with one of your Smite spells, you regain a Level 1 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> after [1] turns.

On a hit, light erupts around you in a [1] area. Enemies in the light take Radiant damage equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> and must succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>.

Once per combat, when you use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Smite_Divine">Divine Smite</LSTag> on a target burning with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING_HOLY">Holy Fire</LSTag>, gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RHERB_AVENGING_WRATH">Avenging Wrath</LSTag> for [1] turns.

While you have <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>, enemies who damage you with melee attacks must make a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or take [1].

When you use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_LayOnHands">Lay on Hands</LSTag> to heal an ally, the recipient gains <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RHERB_BLESSING_OF_RETRIBUTION">Blessing of Retribution</LSTag> for [1] turns.
Blessed with holy fervor. Weapon attacks deal an additional [1].

Gained a shield of [1] <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit point(s)</LSTag>. Upon expiration, the shield explodes, dealing [2] and [3] to all enemies in [4] and possibly knocking them prone. Deals half damage on a successful saving throw.

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, when the wearer is brought below 50% <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, they gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RHERB_MAG_ShieldOfVengeance">Shield of Vengeance</LSTag>.
The shield explodes in holy fire, damaging nearby enemies and possibly knocking them prone.
After this status expires, you regain a Level 1 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
Infuse your weapon with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RHERB_DIVINE_WEAPON">Searing Light</LSTag> for [1] turns, causing it to deal an additional [2] and [3].
Your weapon is infused with searing light. Weapon attacks deal an additional [1] and [2].
You deal 1 additional radiant damage with melee weapons for every turn this condition has remaining.
